result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis Morgan Sullivan

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alexis Morgan Sullivan in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 11/18/2022 at 5:00pm as the deadline for the State to file a response to defenses's motion. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed. Motion to suppress and brief in support of motion

Defendant Alexis Morgan Sullivan in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel requests a Motion Hearing date. Court informs defense that she only schedules motion hearings upon a motion be filed. Court adjourns case for an additional Status Conference date and sets 08/10/2022 deadline for defense to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 7-29-2022

Defendant Alexis Morgan Sullivan in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state, but needs additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 06-27-2022
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (10 pages) commencing 05-09-22 by DANIELLE HOLCOMB.

Defendant Alexis Morgan Sullivan in court by video with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz who appears in person.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Greenfield Officer R. Speich. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 05-06-2022
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.    No driving without a valid license.Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Alexis Morgan Sullivan in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Alexis Morgan Sullivan in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alexis Morgan Sullivan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
